title.narrative: 1.6 COMMUNITY BASED Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH)

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Child Health, Health Systems Strengthening, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: No of states implementing updated pneumonia and diarrhoea prevention and management guidelines (Revised indicator No.1 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:4 out of 15 states: 1. The Government of India had issued new guidelines for implementation of the ‘annual diarrhea control campaign' from March 1 to July 30 by all states. actual.value: 2015:8 out of 15 1. UNICEF provided technical support to Government of India for developing and scale up of online SNCU monitoring system for effective follow-ups of SNCU graduates. 2.
